worklogs.comment:
github-actions[bot] commented on PR #12909:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12909#issuecomment-1100954431

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

jorisvandenbossche commented on code in PR #12909:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12909#discussion_r855459023


##########
python/pyarrow/_dataset_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -327,6 +331,7 @@ cdef class ParquetFileFragment(FileFragment):
     @property
     def metadata(self):
         self.ensure_complete_metadata()
+

Review Comment:
   Small nitpick: but it's best to avoid such (stylistic) changes in code that is otherwise not touched



##########
python/pyarrow/_dataset_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -301,7 +301,11 @@ cdef class ParquetFileFragment(FileFragment):
 
     def __reduce__(self):
         buffer = self.buffer
-        row_groups = [row_group.id for row_group in self.row_groups]
+        if not bool(self.parquet_file_fragment.row_groups()):

Review Comment:
   Can you maybe add a comment to clarify that if `parquet_file_fragment.row_groups()` is empty, this means that the metadata information is not yet populated

kszucs commented on PR #12909:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12909#issuecomment-1108761340

   Could we cover this with a test?

jorisvandenbossche commented on PR #12909:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12909#issuecomment-1109507238

   Actually, on second thought, be _do_ have some infrastructure for testing this, as we had to do something similar in the past for the parquet_dataset constructor. We have the following fixture for a filesystem that logs if a file get accessed:
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/4010916f864783b2a8e7a7d1a9d0187060ec47e7/python/pyarrow/tests/test_dataset.py#L124-L153
   
   and see an example of how this is used:
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/4010916f864783b2a8e7a7d1a9d0187060ec47e7/python/pyarrow/tests/test_dataset.py#L3206-L3228
   
   @Salonijain27 would you have time to take a look at this today? Otherwise I can also take a look

jorisvandenbossche closed pull request #12909: ARROW-15796: [Python] Pickling ParquetFileFragment shouldn't fetch metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12909

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Follow-on to ARROW-15781/https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/12501

Pickling a ParquetFileFragment fetches metadata; we should omit the metadata if it's not already present, since fetching it can incur potentially expensive I/O.

comments.body: One note here that _if_ row group information is present, we should pickle it (otherwise it is changing the meaning of the fragment). So we will need to add a check for whether row_groups/metadata is defined or not (null).
